message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a novel architecture for person-following robots, which involves integrating perception, planning, and robot behavior. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of multi-modal sensor information and Bayesian filtering, which are common techniques in Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes a regression algorithm for predicting the trajectory of people, which is a machine learning technique and falls under the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of a behavior-tree structure for making the robot autonomous, which is a control theory technique and falls under the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
